Package com.example.lotto649.Models

Class UserModel

java.lang.Object
com.example.lotto649.AbstractClasses.AbstractModel
com.example.lotto649.Models.UserModel
public class UserModel extends AbstractModel
UserModel is the data model representing a user in the application. It manages user-specific data such as name, email, phone, and device ID, and interacts with Firestore to save and update user data.

This class extends `AbstractModel`, allowing it to notify associated views when data changes, and provides methods to handle Firestore integration for saving and updating user information.

  • Constructor Details

    • UserModel

      public UserModel()
      No-argument constructor for Firestore deserialization. This constructor is required for creating instances of the `UserModel` when reading from Firestore.

    • UserModel

      public UserModel(android.content.Context context, com.google.firebase.firestore.FirebaseFirestore db)
      Constructor to create a new user model without the given name, email, and phone number. They will all be set to "" Also retrieves the device ID of the current device and immediately saves the user to Firestore.
      Parameters:
      context - the application context used to retrieve the device ID
      db - the firestore database containing user info

    • UserModel

      public UserModel(android.content.Context context, String name, String email, String phone, com.google.firebase.firestore.FirebaseFirestore db)
      Constructor to create a new user model with the given name, email, and phone number. Also retrieves the device ID of the current device and immediately saves the user to Firestore.
      Parameters:
      context - the application context used to retrieve the device ID
      name - the name of the user
      email - the email of the user
      phone - the phone number of the user (optional)

    • UserModel

      public UserModel(android.content.Context context, String name, String email)
      Constructor to create a new user model with the given name and email.
      Parameters:
      context - the application context used to retrieve the device ID
      name - the name of the user
      email - the email of the user

  • Method Details

    • saveUserToFirestore

      public void saveUserToFirestore()
      Saves the current user data to Firestore. This method is called during initialization to persist the user data. Users are default set to entrants

    • updateFirestore

      public void updateFirestore(String field, Object value)
      Updates Firestore with the current user's information. This method is used whenever a setter modifies the user data to synchronize the changes.

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Gets the user's name.
      Returns:
      the name of the user

    • setName

      public void setName(String name)
      Sets the user's name and updates Firestore. Notifies the views about the change.
      Parameters:
      name - the new name of the user

      public void setPhone(String phone)
      Sets the user's phone number and updates Firestore. Notifies the views about the change.
      Parameters:
      phone - the new phone number of the user (can be null)

    • setEntrant

      public void setEntrant(Boolean bool)
      Sets the user's entrant privilege and updates Firestore. Notifies the views about the change.
      Parameters:
      bool - the new privilege of the user (must be true or false)

    • getEntrant

      public Boolean getEntrant()
      Gets the user's entrant privilege.
      Returns:
      the entrant privilege of the user

      Parameters:
